paper_abstract: We show that the problem of finding a minimum dominating set in a circle graph is APX-hard: there is a constant delta > 0 such that there is no (1 + delta)-approximation algorithm for the minimum dominating set problem on circle graphs unless P = NP. Hence a PTAS for this problem seems unlikely. This hardness result complements the (2 + epsilon)-approximation algorithm for the problem [M. Damian, S.V. Pemmaraju, A (2 + epsilon) -approximation scheme for minimum domination on circle graphs, J. Algorithms 42 (2) (2002) 255-276]. (c) 2005 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.
paper_title: APX-hardness of domination problems in circle graphs
